alert.note: Alert for Mellette; Todd; Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued March 20 at 3:04AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .DISCUSSION...Under partly cloudy skies, highs today will reach the mid 60s to mid 70s as minimum relative humidities drop into the teens. Southwest winds will average 12 to 24 mph with higher gusts. Critical fire weather conditions are expected over south central South Dakota. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The grassland fire danger index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. The outlook for Monday afternoon, The grassland fire danger index will reach the very high category to extreme category.
